summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from December 19, 2019, among Bureau of Prisons (BOP) staff and legal counsel regarding missing video surveillance footage and evidence from Jeffrey Epstein's first alleged suicide attempt on July 23, 2019. The emails discuss conflicting reports about the preservation of the footage and the location of an orange rope used in the attempt, with updates from Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs).

persons.name: Adam M. Johnson
persons.role: Deputy Regional Counsel, Northeast Regional Office
persons.context: The primary correspondent who is updating BOP staff on communications with AUSAs regarding the missing video footage and evidence from Epstein's July 23 suicide attempt.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate whose first alleged suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, is the subject of the missing video and evidence inquiry.

persons.name: Charisma Edge
persons.context: Recipient of the email chain among BOP executive staff regarding the Epstein evidence issue.

connections.description: They shared a cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) at the time of Epstein's alleged suicide attempt on July 23, 2019.
Johnson is communicating with Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs) regarding the investigation into missing evidence from Epstein's suicide attempt and relaying their requests to BOP staff.

events.title: Epstein's First Alleged Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's alleged first suicide attempt while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The incident involved an orange rope and was the subject of video surveillance.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: The date referenced as the "8/10 incident," which is when Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell, ruled a suicide.

events.title: Court Hearing
events.description: A court hearing mentioned as having occurred "yesterday," where issues regarding the missing Epstein evidence were discussed.

events.title: Email Correspondence on Missing Evidence
events.description: Series of emails among BOP staff and counsel discussing the missing video footage and orange rope from Epstein's July 23 suicide attempt, and coordinating with AUSAs.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) (implied location of the cell and incidents)
U.S. Customs House, 2nd and Chestnut Streets, Philadelphia, PA 19106 (Adam Johnson's office address)
keyFacts: Video surveillance footage from outside the cell shared by Jeffrey Epstein and inmate Tartaglione during Epstein's alleged first suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, is reported missing or corrupted.
The FBI had possession of the DVR that contained footage from the July 23 attempt, but reported the specific footage was corrupted.
An orange rope used in the July 23 suicide attempt is also a subject of evidence preservation inquiries by prosecutors.

There is internal confusion within the Bureau of Prisons, with Special Investigative Services (SIS) initially advising footage was preserved, contradicting later reports to the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) that it could not be found.
The email chain shows active coordination between BOP legal counsel (Adam Johnson) and Assistant U.S. Attorneys to locate the missing evidence shortly after Epstein's death.
